stimulusHtml: Researchers studying stereotype threat are concerned that approximately 80 percent of study participants are drawn from Western, educated, industrialized, rich, and democratic societies that comprise only 12 percent of the worldâ€™s population. Of the following explanations, which best represents why this finding leads to such uneasiness among psychologists?
choicesHtml: Without a representative sample, it is difficult to identify the independent variable in a study.
Unrepresentative samples have lower test-retest reliability.
A study cannot be considered ethical unless it is representative of the general population.
A representative sample is essential if researchers are to generalize the results to the entire population.
